intro: Trigonotis jiaochengensis, commonly known as the Jiaocheng trigonotis, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, thriving in cool and moist environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered in a fine layer of hair, while its stems are slender and branching. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanically significant species for ecological studies.
